intro: Sida glomerata, commonly known as clusterleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and wetlands. Sida glomerata is often used in traditional medicine and has ecological importance as a food source for certain insects.
